00033 #ifndef SRG_HPP_
00034 #define SRG_HPP_
00035 
00036 #include <stdlib.h>
00037 #include <string.h>
00038 
00039 namespace ebl {
00040 
00041 // Templates for Srg.h
00042 // This is placed in an hpp file so that implementation files can instanciate templates.
00043 
00045 // the creation of an Idx should call lock() on the Srg,
00046 // and its destruction should call unlock().
00047 
00048 // simplest constructor builds an empty Srg
00049 template <class T> Srg<T>::Srg() {
00050   refcount = 0;
00051   data = (T *)NULL;
00052   size_ = 0;
00053 }
00054 
00055 // return size on success, and -1 on error
00056 template <class T> Srg<T>::Srg(intg s) {
00057   intg r;
00058   refcount = 0;
00059   data = (T *)NULL;
00060   if ( ( r=this->changesize(s) ) > 0 ) this->clear();
00061   if (r < 0) { ylerror("can't allocate Srg"); }
00062 }
00063 
00064 // destructor: can be called twice when the Srg
00065 // is not dynamically allocated. Hence this must
00066 // make sure the data is not deallocated twice.
00067 template <class T> Srg<T>::~Srg() {
00068   DEBUG("Srg::destructor: refcount=%d\n",refcount);
00069   if (refcount != 0) { ylerror("can't delete an Srg with non zero refcount"); }
00070   if (data != NULL) {
00071     free((void *)data);
00072     data = NULL;
00073     size_ =0;
00074   }
00075 }
00076 
00077 // return size
00078 template <class T> intg Srg<T>::size() { return size_; }
00079 
00080 // low-level resize: can grow and shrink
00081 // returns -1 on failure.
00082 // Self should be used with care, because shrinking
00083 // an Srg that has Idx pointing to it is very dangerous.
00084 // In most case, the grow() method should be used.
00085 template <class T> intg Srg<T>::changesize(intg s) {
00086   if (s == 0) {
00087     free((void *)data);
00088     data = (T *)NULL;
00089     size_ = 0;
00090   } else {
00091     data = (T *)realloc((void *)data, s*sizeof(T));
00092     if (data != NULL) {
00093       size_ = s;
00094       return size_;
00095     } else {
00096       size_ = 0;
00097       return -1;
00098     }
00099   }
00100   return size_;
00101 }
00102 
00103 // this grows the size of the srg if necessary.
00104 // This is called when a new Idx is created on the Srg.
00105 // returns -1 on failure.
00106 template <class T> intg Srg<T>::growsize(intg s) {
00107   if (s > size_) { return this->changesize(s); } else { return size_; }
00108 }
00109 
00110 template<class T> intg Srg<T>::growsize_chunk(intg s, intg s_chunk){
00111         if(s > size_) { return this->changesize(s + s_chunk); } else {return size_;}
00112 }
00113 
00114 // decrement refcount and free if it reaches zero
00115 template <class T> int Srg<T>::unlock() {
00116   refcount--;
00117   DEBUG("Srg::unlock: refcount=%d\n",refcount);
00118   if (refcount<0) { ylerror("Srg has negative refcount"); return refcount; }
00119   else {
00120     if (refcount == 0) { delete this; return 0; } else { return refcount; }
00121   }
00122 }
00123 
00124 // increment refcount
00125 template <class T> int Srg<T>::lock() {
00126   DEBUG("Srg::lock: refcount=%d\n",refcount+1);
00127   return ++refcount;
00128 }
00129 
00130 // get i-th item
00131 template <class T> T Srg<T>::get(intg i) { return data[i]; }
00132 
00133 // set i-th item
00134 template <class T> void Srg<T>::set(intg i, T val) { data[i] = val; }
00135 
00136 // fill with a ubyte value
00137 template <class T> void Srg<T>::clear() { memset(data, 0, size_ * sizeof(T)); }
00138 
00139 // prints innards
00140 template <class T> void Srg<T>::pretty(FILE *f) {
00141   fprintf(f,"Srg at address %ld; ",(long)this);
00142   fprintf(f,"size=%ld; ",size_);
00143   fprintf(f,"data=%ld; ",(long)data);
00144   fprintf(f,"refcount=%d\n",refcount);
00145 }
00146 
00147 } // end namespace ebl
00148 
00149 #endif /* SRG_HPP_ */
